intro: Erigeron paghmanicus, commonly known as Paghman's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron paghmanicus is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
